meanings.definition: Delay or block (a request, process, or person) by refusing to answer questions or by giving evasive replies.
meanings.sent1: The child kept stonewalling when asked about the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: She was stonewalling the investigation by not providing any information.
meanings.sent3: The cat was stonewalling the dog's attempts to play by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog was stonewalling the sunlight from reaching the valley.
meanings.sent5: The locked door was stonewalling their escape from the burning building.

meanings.definition: An act of delaying or blocking a request, process, or person by refusing to answer questions or by giving evasive replies.
meanings.sent1: The company's stonewalling of the media raised suspicions.
meanings.sent2: His constant stonewalling was frustrating the progress of the project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's stonewalling of the bird trying to share the feeder was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The mountain's height acted as a natural stonewalling of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The thick bureaucracy was a stonewalling obstacle to getting approval for the new policy.
